page.title: 11FISHERMAN INTERVIEW(contd.)
page.content: We fish up to forty miles out,that is wreck fishing, it is a natural habitat for fish like conger, pollock,bream,ling,they all feed on each other.We often fish on the Skerries bank,which may only be 30 ft in depth,but the average depth is 50-60 ft..Once we caught an 86lb conger,but the biggest fish was I suppose a cod of about 30lbs.I've caught ling also,nothing exceptional at 30lb.. Pollock,well I had the world record on pollock at one time on light line. I believe in educating the anglers to fish as light as possible and they're gradually coming over to this way of fishing.I had a very good pollock on record for two weeks.The chap that knocked me off was a chap I took on my boat. But I dont mind,it was caught on my boat."
